poem:
Title: "In Twilight, Beneath Corporate Clocks"

Beside checkout queues and discount walls,
In the silent chorale of empty carts, awaits
Unwanted food – not yet lost, but edged in time's thrall.
Charities reach out, hands thwarted by dusk's gates.
Night's charity, a bitter brew served cold,
Under neon lights, hunger speaks untold.
Mocked by hands of corporate clocks,
In twilight, we gather scraps and bread-stalks.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
